title: Episode I - The Beginning
description: When the ancient evil Aku returns to terrorize Japan, the emperors young son is send to distant lands to train in the ways of the warrior. Only then can he wield his fathers magical sword to stop Aku from taking over the world.

title: Episode II - The Samurai Called Jack
description: Aku has transported his mortal samurai enemy into the far future in which Aku rules all. Now the warrior has to find a way back while adjusting to his new surroundings. He also takes a new name: Jack.

title: Episode III - The First Fight
description: Akus destroyer beetle drones are closing in on Samurai Jack and the pack of archaeologist dogs, therefore Jack decides to use anything and everything at hand to defend themselves.

title: Episode IV - Jack, the Woolies and the Chritchellites
description: While hunting for food, Jack helps the tiny Chritchellites recapture an escaped Woolie. But once they invite him back to their village for dinner, Jack begins to suspect an imbalance in the pecking order.

title: Episode V - Jack in Space
description: Samurai Jack hooks up with a group of scientists who are secretly building a rocket to escape from Akus service. When they hear about Jacks predicament, the scientist come up with a way to send him back in time.

title: Episode VI - Jack and the Warrior Woman
description: Jack is aided by an equally skilled warrior woman with a dark secret to search for a crystal with magical properties.

title: Episode VII - Jack and the Three Blind Archers
description: Jack learns about a wishing well of King Osric on top of a tower protected by three unbeatable archers and vows to make his way past them.

title: Episode VIII - Jack vs. Mad Jack
description: Despite a reward of Two Googooplex on his head, no bounty hunter has been able to defeat Samurai Jack, therefore Aku creates an evenly matched mirror image of Jack to battle him.

title: Episode IX - Jack Under the Sea
description: Samurai Jack ventures into the deep end of the ocean after hearing of a time portal can be found in Oceanis, the sunken underwater city of the Triceraquin.

title: Episode X - Jack and the Lava Monster
description: Having made his way through a cave filled with booby-traps, Samurai Jack faces a giant lava monster that used to be a viking warrior in days long past.

title: Episode XI - Jack and the Scotsman
description: Samurai Jack is crossing a seemingly endless rope bridge when he meets another wanted man coming from the other side: the Scotsman. After fighting each other to a stalemate, they are forced to team-up when bounty hunters arrive on the scene and shackle Jack and the Scotsman to each other.

title: Episode XII - Jack and the Gangsters
description: Samurai Jack gets an offer to join a Thirties style gang of mobsters at the Blue Monkey club and decides to take them up on it so he can get close to Aku. The gang plans to steal something Aku has been unable to obtain: the legendary Neptune Jewel, guarded by Earth, Wind and Fire.

title: Episode XIII - Akus Fairy Tales
description: Samurai Jack has become a popular folk hero amongst little children, so Aku decides to spread his own kind of fairy tales that put Jack in a bad light.

title: Episode XIV - Jack Learns to Jump Good
description: After reaching a time portal only to have Aku move it beyond reach at the last moment, Samurai Jack meets a wild man with extraordinary jumping skills. He offers to learn tribe of monkeys that raised the wild man how to defend themselves if they will in turn teach him how to jump good.

title: Episode XV - Jack Tales
description: Three scary stories. Jack enters the land of the magic worm to ask it to grant him a magic wish. At night, Jack meets a family of cannibal robots who hunger for his magic sword. Jack tries to rescue a wish giving fairy from captivity by a greedy gargoyle.

title: Episode XVI - Jack and the Smackback
description: Samurai Jack is ambushed while hes sleeping and taken to the Dome of Doom. There he is given the name Two Sandles and has to fight to the death for the spectators amusement.

title: Episode XVII - Jack and the Scotsman II
description: The Scotsman asks Samurai Jack for help him rescue his wife from the Keltic Master o the Hunt who plans to devour her in the Castle of Bone.

title: Episode XVIII - Jack and the Ultra-Robots
description: Jack follows a path of destruction that leads to a group of Adamantium Ultra-Robots built especially to defeat him.

title: Episode XIX - Jack Remembers the Past
description: On his journey, Jack happens upon his the place he once called home and begins to recall his childhood there.

title: Episode XX - Jack and the Monks
description: Having been deprived of yet another gateway to the past and after almost losing his hat, Samurai Jack is unsure if he can still go on. Then he meets three mountain monks and joins them on their quest to climb the mountain of Fathoom.

title: Episode XXI - Jack and the Dragon
description: Jack follows a trail of stench in an effort to rid the land of this sickening smell. It leads him to a spire where a dragon suffers from a stomach ache.

title: Episode XXII - Jack vs. the Five Hunters
description: Aku hires the best hunters in the universe, the Imakandi, to track down Samurai Jack.

title: Episode XXIII - Jack vs. Demongo, the Soul Collector
description: Aku unleashes upon Samurai Jack Demongo, who commands the essence of many great warriors who once threatened Aku.

title: Episode XXIV - Jack Is Naked
description: While bathing, Jacks sword, shoes and clothing are stolen by what looks like a white rabbit. When Jack follows the culprit down a hole, he enters a strange underground realm like none he has ever seen.

title: Episode XXV - Jack and the Spartans
description: Samurai Jack joins 300 Spartans in their age old war against a mad mechanical beast.

title: Episode XXVI - Jacks Shoes
description: Samurai Jacks sandals are run over and destroyed by three robot bikers. Unable to defeat them without protection on his feet, Jack tries out all the latest footwear from the world famous Foot Chalet. But none are adequate replacements.

title: Episode XXVII - Chicken Jack
description: Samurai Jack accidentally bumps into an easily irritated wizard, who turns him into a chicken. Before he can catch up with the wicked sorcerer, Chicken Jack is captured and forced to fight for his life in Creature Combat Club.

title: Episode XXVIII - Jack and the Rave
description: Samurai Jack enters a town where all the children have fallen under the spell of Akus rave music and vows to release every one of them from Akus evil grasp.

title: Episode XXIX - Couple on a Train
description: Samurai Jack boards a train in the new old West and finds himself cornered by bounty hunter Ezekiel Clench as well as a beautiful filly named Josephine.

title: Episode XXX - Jack and the Zombies
description: Aku leads Samurai Jack towards a graveyard where the undead do the evil shape-shifters bidding.

title: Episode XXXI - Jack and the Scarab
description: Aku releases the minions of Set who were trapped in ancient Egypt and orders them to destroy Samurai Jack. Luckily Jack knows his way around the pyramids from when he was a boy.

title: Episode XXXII - Jack and the Traveling Creatures
description: Several creatures help Samurai Jack to travel to an island where a time passage is located. However it is protected by an unbeatable warrior. Only the one to defeat this guardian may enter the passage.

title: Episode XXXIII - Jack and the Annoying Creature
description: Samurai Jack is unable to get rid of a large furry animal that insists on following him.

title: Episode XXXIV - Jack and the Swamp Wizard
description: An old hermit who lives in a swamp leads Samurai Jack on a quest to unite the three gems of the Titans: the Eye of Chronos and the fists of Might and Ability.

title: Episode XXXV - Jack and the Haunted House
description: Samurai Jack follows a little girl to return the doll she lost in the woods. She leads him into a haunted house filled with memories of the previous inhabitants.

title: Episode XXXVI - Jack, the Monks and the Ancient Masters Son
description: As Samurai Jack fights two Shaolin monks they are surprised to recognize each others fighting styles. They take him to their secret hidden temple where Grandmaster Tan Zang points Jack towards a time portal. Unfortunately the way to the portal is heavily defended.

title: Episode XXXVII - The Birth of Evil: Part I
description: The origin of Aku and how he came to terrorize the Earth from the days of the dinosaurs onwards.

title: Episode XXXVIII - The Birth of Evil: Part II
description: The young emperor is helpless against the evil of Aku. But the ancient gods Odin, Ra and Rama combine forces to forge a sword for him representing all that is good: the only weapon that can hurt Aku.

title: Episode XXXIX - Jack and the Labyrinth
description: Samurai Jack has been given a map of a booby trap ridden labyrinth that holds a powerful diamond that can return him to his own time. But he gets some competition from an equally accomplished master thief.

title: Episode XL - Jack vs. the Ninja
description: A deadly Ninja warrior has honed his skills to fight Samurai Jack. But just as he is about to ambush him, Jack is called away to rescue a village from attacking crab monsters.

title: Episode XLI - Robo-Samurai vs. Mondo-bot
description: Robots that dwell in the sewers of Andromeda ask Jack to enter a giant Robot Samurai and battle Mondo Bot who terrorizes the city.

title: Episode XLII - Samurai vs. Samurai
description: Samurai Jack is challenged to a duel by Da Samurai, who despite all his big mouth is not worthy to face Jacks blade.

title: Episode XLIII - The Aku Infection
description: During battle, Samurai Jack accidentally swallows a piece of darkness coughed up by a sickly Aku. When Akus blackness begins to take over the Samurai, he seeks help from Master Ning.

title: Episode XLIV - The Princess and the Bounty Hunters
description: Bounty Hunters Jo Junga the Aborigional, I & Am the infamous twins, The Gentleman & Boris the Russian have all tracked down Samurai Jack up North. Princess Mira of the Andaluvians convinces them to join forces and attack the Samurai together.

title: Episode XLV - The Scotsman Saves Jack: Part I
description: The Scotsman recognizes Samurai Jack working as a water boy on a boat and calling himself Brent Worthington. He then decides to find out why and where Jack got his memory erased by retracing his steps.

title: Episode XLVI - The Scotsman Saves Jack: Part II
description: The Scotsman has saved Jack from living out the rest of his life as a water boy. Now they have to settle which one is more worthy to man the oars on the way back.

title: Episode XLVII - Jack and the Flying Prince and Princess
description: Princess Verbina and Prince Astor of the Lebidoptirans are on a quest to find their star navy to save their home world Chrystalis. But they are forced to crash land on Akus Earth and are immediately captured by his minions. Luckily Samurai Jack is witness to the events and follows them.

title: Episode XLVIII - Jack vs. Aku
description: After all else fails, Aku challenges Samurai Jack to a duel. To make sure of a fair fight, Jack is not allowed to use his sword while Aku must fight in human form, without minions and magic tricks.

title: Episode XLIX - The Four Seasons of Death
description: As Jack goes through fall, winter, spring and summer, he must battle the perils that each season brings.

title: Episode L - Tale of X-49
description: An experimental X-series robot was given emotions as an experiment and therefore was the only one of its kind to survive intact. It retired after taking a shine to sweet thing Lulu, but Aku forces it to take on one more job: hunt down Samurai Jack.

title: Episode LI - Young Jack in Africa
description: A tale told in flashback concerning the childhood training of Samurai Jack in Africa, but, even as part the Nubian tribe, the young prince is not safe from Akus minions.

title: Episode LII - Jack and the Baby
description: Samurai Jack saves a baby boy from three hungry Ogres and looks after him while searching for the childs parents.

title: Episode XCII
description: A samurai warrior fights against the evil entity that took him away from his home world.

title: Episode XCIII
description: Out of weapons and pursued relentlessly by the masterful seven Daughters of Aku, Jack faces what may be his final confrontation.

title: Episode XCIV
description: A gravely injured Samurai Jack chooses to create his own fate by going up against the deadliest foes hes ever faced, Assassins from the Cult of Aku.

title: Episode XCV
description: Samurai Jack partners with a deadly assassin in order to escape a gargantuan creature that has swallowed them whole.

title: Episode XCVI
description: Samurai Jack fights to save a village from a horrible fate.

title: Episode XCVII
description: After Jack left with the mysterious figure Ashi goes on a quest to find him.

title: Episode XCVIII
description: Jack looks for his sword and Ashi fends off attackers, including someone from her past.

title: Episode XCIX
description: Samurai Jack and Ashi find themselves hunted by one of the Galaxys deadliest creatures.

title: Episode C
description: Samurai Jacks worst fear is realized when he faces off against Aku; the demon makes a shocking discovery about Ashi that puts her in grave danger.

title: Episode CI
description: The fate of the entire universe hangs in the balance as Samurai Jack faces Aku.
